|+*Stage / Job Status*+| | |
|*DLY DISPATCHED*|AFTER IMPORT DELIVERY IS DISPATCHED, JOB CAN BE MARKED FOR UPDATING IN WH TAB. After which job entry will shift and show in WH Tab.|[Pop-up for minimum mandatory fields alert, if left blank]|
|*SYSTEM GRN DONE (IN LOGISYNC)*|Once the above minimum mandatory fields are updated, the staus of that job will show as *'System GRN Done'*. Which means that as per documents and import BE, GRN has been updated *including all minimum mandatory fields*.
At this stage, our Outbond team is ready to book Exbond and BTBT orders, prior to actual WH GRN, in case of any urgent orders to be processed.| |
|*GOODS UNLOADED AT WH*| | |
|*WH GRN DONE*|Once WH completes and sends to us their GRN, then FEC will verify the actual WH GRN v/s LogiSync GRN, for all details including batch numbers and expiry dates, and thereafter mark the job as *'GRN Verified'*. Once this is done, the Import Side job entry will get FREEEZED and no one can modify the inbond job, except rights given to particular selected persons.
In case of any discrepancy or breakages, shortages, etc are recorded in actual WH GRN, then those outbond jobs will be created in system so that that particular stock gets blocked, and those entries will be updated in our GRN remarks with the outbond job numbers as well. *User will upload WH receiving copy (mandatory) + WH GRN copy.* Only thereafter the job will be marked as 'GRN Verified' and it will freeze.
[User will get Pop-up alert, with *alert for mandatory fields if left blank AND declaration ticks for a) Discrepancies verified and updated, b) WH recvng uploaded, c) WH GRN uploaded*, only then it will proceed to freeze job and mark as GRN verified.]|GRN remarks exaample,
E.g.1: *"WH GRN verified. No discrepancy. WH receiving copy and GRN uploaded."*
E.g.2: *"As per WH GRN, Discrepancy 1 = inv sr.2, item sr.4, Chivas abcdxyz, 3 bottles breakage found, booked via Outbond job no. BTBT/01234/SEA/25-26, Discrepancy 2 = inv sr.3, item sr.1, Ballentine XYZ, 1 bottle breakage found, booked via Outbond job no. BTBT/01235/SEA/25-26. WH GRN verified and discrepancies are booked as above. WH receiving copy and GRN uploaded."*|
|*GRN VERIFIED (IN LOGISYNC)*|Done| |

raw.Summary: BTBT- Develop an automated Excel report for Inbond–Outbond Stock, generated individually for each Bond Number, following the business logic provided by stakeholders.
raw.Description:
h2. Business Logic & Requirements

# Bond Status Logic

* If all stock values in Column H are 0 → G1 = 'Bond is NIL'
* If any value > 0 → G1 remains blank

# Supplier Display Rules

* Single supplier → Display supplier name
* Multiple suppliers → First supplier name + ' + Others'

Example: LINDT & SPRUNGLI (SCHWEIZ) AG + Others

# Outbond Job Rules

* Each job (BTBT or Exbond) gets a column starting from N
* All job details populated in that column
* Total outbond jobs → Cell M3

Delivery Date Rule

* If delivery date blank → Job marked as 'Pending'

h2. *Acceptance Criteria (Developer + QA)*

h3. *AC1 – Bond NIL Logic*

* If all items in Column H = 0 → G1 shows *“Bond is NIL”*
* If any item has value > 0 → G1 remains blank

h3. *AC2 – Supplier Rule*

* Single supplier → Show name
* Multiple suppliers → {{<First Supplier> + Others}}

h3. *AC3 – Outbond Job Mapping*

* Each job generates its own column starting from N
* All details are correctly grouped under that job
* Cell M3 shows correct total job count

h3. *AC4 – Pending Status Rule*

* If delivery date blank → Status = *Pending*

h3. *AC5 – Excel Output*

* Formatting is clean, readable, consistent
* File name format: {{BTBT_Report_<BondNumber>_<Date>.xlsx}}

h3. *AC6 – Error Handling*

* Missing data does not break generation
* Appropriate error messages logged

----

h2. *🧪 Testing Requirements*

h3. *Test Scenarios*

# Bond where all stock = 0 → G1 = “Bond is NIL”
# Bond where at least one stock > 0 → G1 blank
# Only one supplier
# Multiple suppliers
# Multiple outbond jobs
# No outbond jobs
# Delivery date blank → Pending
# Mixed BTBT & Exbond jobs
# Invalid/missing data validation
# Output formatting checks

raw.Summary: Import module:[RP1 + Workflow auto assigned]
raw.Description:
The mandatory fields in pop-up are a big pain for the user to manually update for each job and are much time consuming, inspite of the multi update in the pop-up.

After much thought into this, a simple solution has been derived by which all the fields will be auto-assigned and only the EXCEPTIONS – if any – will show in the pop-up window for updating.

 

* We have already covered the assigning of the CRM in the Organisation Master, so once a Primary CRM has been assigned in the Org Master, then by default that CRM will show for each job of that Org

 

* As per attached Excel, we will do a ONE-TIME setup of assigning a “default” workflow for each BE category.

o   By doing this, all the BE categories which are pre-defined, will already have a workflow assigned to it which is the default workflow. This can be overruled and superseded by another workflow if defined in an Organisation Master for that BE category.

o   If the BE category does not exist, or the name is mismatch or blank, only then the workflow will be blank.
And immediately user will be highlighted of these exceptions and can create the new BE category and assign the default workflow OR can manually update the correct workflow.

 

* Based on the execution of the above, by default ALL the jobs coming through RP1 will already have the Workflow and CRM pre-assigned

raw.Summary: Delivery Tab - for import job
raw.Description:
TAB 1 = ASSIGN TASKS

* *SHOW LIST OF IMPORT JOBS* for which Duty has been paid (Home) OR Bond Procedure has been completed (In-Bond)

* *Users will select the jobs* which he wants to *ASSIGN TASKS AND TASKS PERFORM DATE* (in POP UP) and save – JOBS WILL *MOVE TO NEXT PAGE* and no longer show on this page


(note that Tasks does not mean only Delivery, Tasks means assigning any of the tasks for that job for any field persons, e.g. FSSAI sampling or Examination or BE assessment)



TAB 2 = MANAGE SCHEDULE

* User will *ASSIGN PERSONS* FOR MULTIPLE JOBS, MULTIPLE TASKS and *GENERATE DAILY SCHEDULE – as per attached Excel Template* (which will be emailed and sent on whatsapp as PDF – subject and body mentioned in attached file) and also another *TRANSPORTATION REQUIREMENT EXCEL* will be generated as attached (at present I am not getting into vehicle wise assignment – maybe we can do that later?)

* User should be able to ADD NEW TASKS, REASSIGN TASKS TO DIFFERENT PERSONS, PUT JOB ON HOLD – and regenerate the schedule.

* Jobs will keep piling up into the schedule until ALL ASSIGNED TASKS ARE DONE AND JOB IS MARKED AS COMPLETED

THEN COMPLETED JOB WILL MOVE TO HANDOVER TAB (in HO Tab, user can assign further Tasks to the completed jobs, which will be the tasks post-delivery but prior to job history as explained above)

raw.Summary: PR Module [enhancement]- Stamp Duty / State Excise
raw.Description:
Attached is below which was pending in previous email.

# PDF download on all pages (F1 in e-docket) after Submit Payment Request
*PR250601-001-MTRPL-IMP.00121.SEA.25-26-STAMP-DUTY.pdf (Payment Request PDF in case of Stamp Duty only)*

Please note that the margins need to be set as per my attached Excel so that the print by default fits in a A4 single page PDF.

 

In Organisation Master, add field,”*IsStatutory?*”. If this is ticked, then for that Beneficiary Vendor, KYC tab will NOT be mandatory and in remarks it will show as *KYC NA*, instead of KYC OK or KYC Pending.

 

If For Purpose head is selected as *STAMP DUTY* or *STATE EXCISE TTP FEES* or *STATE EXCISE*, then

Instead of regular PR PDF, the attached SD PR PDF will be available for download.

 

----

User flow will be as below for the above,

PART 1

* Ops side user will submit Stamp Duty PR as a *“PROFORMA” submission* for payment. Invoice number will be entered as the word DUMMY and date will be input by user as submission date. In case of PROFORMA submission, the upload PDF will NOT be mandatory and can be left blank.
* Finance user will verify the submission on PR Verification page and proceed with draft submission on GRAS portal. Finance user can copy paste data from the SD PR PDF.

PART 2

* Same Finance user (inputer), will do *EDIT PR* and resubmit the PR as a *“FINAL” submission with GRN number* and date in the Invoice details and upload the draft GRAS submission Word / PDF file in upload Invoice. In case of FINAL submission, the Upload PDF will be mandatory.
* Finance user (inputer), will proceed with VERIFIED -> BOOKED IN TALLY

PART 3

* PAID
Another Finance user (approver), will verify the second submission and proceed with verify and authorise pay on SBI portal. And then go to GRAS portal and verify and download the final GRN challan copy from GRAS.
* On Payment page, Finance user will have EDIT PR in Menu – basis which he can directly EDIT the PR in case of any issue noticed at the time of payment
* Approving Finance user will upload the GRN challan copy in the Payment update details as the receipt.

raw.Summary: PR - 2 pages [Verification and Booking / Paid Status]
raw.Description:
On home page, after login, a similar box will come as below,

Title = Submit Payment Request

Text = Submit invoices for booking and payment

Go - button

as given in mail.



Main menu on top,

+*Accounting*+

* *Submit Payment Request*

* *PR Verification and Booking*

* *PR Paid Status*

 

*‘PR Verification and Booking’* page process flow

# All submitted Payment Requests – whether directly come with Approval as ‘NA’ or have come from Approval Page -> will reflect in this list with default PR status as ‘PENDING FOR VERIFICATION’

# Verification of PR

a.      Finance will click on right side menu -> Verify PR. A pop-up window will open, on the left side it will show the PR print version (as per PDF view) and on the right side it will show the Invoice copy of which the PDF has been uploaded by user who has issued the PR. Finance will verify the input details in PR v/s the actual vendor invoice and will click on ‘Verified’ button -> after which the PR status will change to ‘VERIFIED’

b.      If there is discrepancy in the PR input v/s the actual vendor invoice, then Finance will click on ‘Discrepancy’ button instead of Verified button and input 1 sentence remark on what the discrepancy is. After this is saved the Status PENDING FOR VERIFICATION will have a red background differentiating it from the others.

c.      Finance will inform the PR issued by Person, and that person (or Finance), will click on ‘EDIT PR’ in the right side menu, after which the entire PR as originally submitted will be opened in the ‘SUBMIT PR’ page with pre-filled data, and the user will then edit and rectify as necessary and will then re-submit the PR. Once re-submitted it will overwrite the original entry, and status with normal background colour will show and will again follow the same process of VERIFICATION by Finance.

# Booking Entries in Tally

a.      Finance will tick and select single or multiple PR (only those with status as VERIFIED), and then click on SUBMIT TO TALLY button.

b.      Upon clicking Submit, the *API for JV (4 nos.) / Purchase (1 no.)* *_(already given by Mustafa)_* will run. Depending on the type of JV or Purchase entry, that particular API will run for each PR and do the posting into Tally with narrations. After successful posting, the Tally Booking Vch Ref. number will get updated and status of PR will change to ‘BOOKED IN TALLY’

c.      If for any reason the API does not work or fails, then Finance will do manual booking entry directly into Tally as per PR and supporting Invoice as per present practice and then manually input the Tally Booking Voucher Ref. number into Logisync.

# Submitting for Payment

a.      Finance will tick and select single or multiple PR (only those with status as BOOKED IN TALLY and then click on SUBMIT FOR PAYMENT button

b.      All the selected PRs will be clubbed into a single LOT NUMBER and will disappear from this page and will appear in the listing on the next page, i.e. in PR PAYMENT page.

 

 

*‘PR Payment’ page process flow*

# All ‘Booked in Tally’ PR submitted for payment will reflect in this list from previous tab, and shown LOT-WISE

# Payment submission to Bank

a.      Finance can download ready Excel (as per HDFC Bank ENET template), either for individual Job or for one Lot. Finance will upload the Excel into HDFC for input of the entries into ENET. After upload all entries will be visible in ENET to proceed for authorisation and payment.

b.      _[for later after API is activated]_ Finance will select individual job or multiple jobs or lots and click on ‘Submit to Bank [API]’. The API will run and all those selected PR will be input directly from system into HDFC ENET system. After all entries will be visible in ENET, Finance to proceed for authorisation and payment.

c.      If both above options fail or are not used, then Finance can input manual entry directly into HDFC ENET system as per present practice, as per each PR

# Payment updating in Logisync, after payment is done in Bank

a.      Finance will click on right side menu and select ‘Manual Payment Update’. A pop-up will show in which the payment details will be manually input and saved.

b.      _[for later after API is activated]_ Finance will click on ‘Update Payment Status [API]’, after which the API will run and call for the payment details directly from HDFC Enet into LogiSync and payment details will be auto updated from Bank into our system.

As soon as payment details are updated in LogiSync, Pay Now or Pay Later will change to -> ‘PAID’

# Payment Entry into Tally

a.      As soon as the payment details are updated in LogiSync as per 3a or 3b, the *API for Payment Entry into Tally* *_(already given by Mustafa)_* will run. And then the Payment Tally Vch Ref. number will get updated and status of PR will change to ‘PAID IN TALLY’
